skill.name: Test Readability and Clarity Check Approach
skill.description: The Test Readability and Clarity Check is a dual-agent validation approach that assesses whether a test suite effectively documents system behavior by reconstructing system understanding purely fro...

principles.title: Test-as-Documentation
principles.description: Tests should comprehensively document system behavior so that reading tests alone enables understanding of what the system does.

principles.title: Separation of Concerns
principles.description: Isolate behavioral documentation (what/how) from architectural rationale (why) to identify documentation gaps systematically.

principles.title: Dual Perspective
principles.description: Combine naive analysis (tests-only) with expert review (full context) to quantify test documentation quality.

principles.title: Measurable Outcomes
principles.description: Generate accuracy metrics to track test quality improvements over time and justify test investment.

principles.title: Actionable Feedback
principles.description: Produce specific recommendations for enhancing test suite documentation value. ---

when_to_use: Major test suite refactoring completed (validate improvement)
New team members onboarding (generate system overview)
Architecture documentation audit needed (find alignment gaps)
Quality gate before major release (comprehensive validation)
Quarterly quality reviews (track test suite evolution)
when_not_to_use: Daily code changes or simple bug fixes (too heavyweight)
UI/UX validation needed (tests don't capture UX)
Time/budget constraints prohibit deep analysis (65+ minutes)
